Package javelin.controller.challenge

Class TensionDirector

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.challenge.TensionDirector
  • public class TensionDirector
extends java.lang.Object
    A director to help Minigame and Haunt Fights maintain a certain Difficulty balance throughout their durations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  TensionDirector.TensionAction

      protected boolean escalating  
      java.util.List<Combatant> monsters
      A group of units that fulfills the next tension requirement.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TensionDirector()
      Default director, suitable to Haunts, for example.
      TensionDirector​(int min, int max, boolean raising)
      Note that this range is not guaranteed but fullfilled on a best-attempt basis.

    • Field Detail

      • monsters

        public java.util.List<Combatant> monsters
        A group of units that fulfills the next tension requirement. May be empty if EncounterGenerator had trouble coming up with appropriately-challenging enemies. Starts as null and is never reset, only replaced. This can be used by consumers to identify whether the first group has been generated.
        See Also:
        #check(List, ArrayList, float)

      • escalating

        protected boolean escalating

    • Constructor Detail

      • TensionDirector

        public TensionDirector​(int min,
                       int max,
                       boolean raising)
        Note that this range is not guaranteed but fullfilled on a best-attempt basis.
        Parameters:
        min - Minimum Difficulty.
        max - Maximum Difficulty.
        raising - If set to true, will ensure new waves are never less challenging than previous ones.

      • TensionDirector

        public TensionDirector()
        Default director, suitable to Haunts, for example.

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public TensionDirector.TensionAction check​(java.util.List<Combatant> blue,
                                           java.util.List<Combatant> red,
                                           float ap)
        Parameters:
        ap - Current Combatant.ap.
        Returns:
        false if doesn't need to raise Fight tension, otherwise true and updates monsters.

      • delay

        public void delay​(float currentap)
        Default implementation adds 1d4 turns (with .1ap granurality).
        Parameters:
        currentap - Will add a certain delay to this given value and not allow a check(List, List, float) before that.

      • generate

        protected java.util.List<Combatant> generate​(int elblue,
                                             java.util.List<Combatant> red)
        Calls generate(int) systematically to produce an appropriate gruop of monsters.
        Parameters:
        elblue - Blue team Encounter Level.
        red - Red team.
        Returns:
        List of monsters that tries to fulfill the tension requirement or Collections.emptyList() if couldn't find one.

      • generate

        protected java.util.List<Combatant> generate​(int el)
                                      throws GaveUp
        Returns:
        Given an Encounter Level, an appropriate gruop of monsters.
        Throws:
        GaveUp - If cannot fulfill this condition.

      • force

        public void force()
        Makes sure next call to check(List, List, float) will go through regardless of the Action Point parameter.
